KYC 2

POST /v1/kyc/upload/document

The endpoint is used to upload documents as part of the KYC (Know Your Customer) Level 2 identity verification process, transmitting information about the required documents to confirm a user’s identity. The process of completing KYC 2 can be read here.

Request

Query Parameters


  • docType: string (required)
    The type of the uploaded document.

Allowed values for the field:

  • PASSPORT_FRONT: Front side of a passport document.

  • DRIVING_LICENCE_FRONT: Front side of a driving license document.

  • ID_CARD_FRONT: Front side of an ID card document.

  • PASSPORT_BACK: Back side of a passport document.

  • DRIVING_LICENCE_BACK: Back side of a driving license document.

  • ID_CARD_BACK: Back side of an ID card document.

  • SELFIE: Selfie photograph.

  • UTILITY_BILL: Utility bill document.

  • BANK_STATEMENT: Bank statement document.

  • CREDIT_CARD_STATEMENT: Credit card statement document.

  • GOVERNMENT_CORRESPONDENCE: Government correspondence document.

  • VIDEO_VERIFICATION: Video verification recording.

Body

Parameters


  • image: string (required)
    The request body containing the document image in the $binary format.

Responses

200 - OK

The response status code indicates that the request was successfully processed.


  • id: string
    Upload document image.

Responses example

{
  "result": "ok"
}
400 - Bad Request

The response status code indicates that the requested page was not found on the server.

Body

  • message: string
    Message displayed to the user.
  • field: string
    Specifies the field in the request that caused the error.
  • errorId: integer
    Identifier of the error.
  • systemId: string
    Identifier of the component.
  • originalMessage: string
    The original error message.
  • errorStackTrace: string
    The place where the error occurred in the code.
  • data: object
    Additional data related to the error, structured as key-value pairs.
    • additionalProp1: object
    • additionalProp2: object
    • additionalProp3: object
  • error: string
    Identifier of the error.

Responses example

{
  "error": "COMMON",
  "errorId": 0,
  "message": "Sorry for inconvenience. We're fixing the issue. If you have urgent questions, contact support",
  "systemId": "core"
}
